definitions: Be involved in a romantic relationship, typically with the intention of marrying.
Try to win the favor or support of (a person or group).
Attempt to gain or achieve (something, typically something undesirable).
To attract or invite (attention, trouble, etc.).
examples: He courted her for two years before proposing.
The politician courted the youth vote.
He was courting disaster with his reckless driving.
She courted controversy with her outspoken views.
